burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.common

Class StateValuePainter2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.StateValuePainter
      • burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.common.StateValuePainter2D

  • public class StateValuePainter2D
extends StateValuePainter
    A class for rendering the value of states as colored 2D cells on the canvas.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ColorBlend colorBlend
      The object to use for returning the color with which to fill the state cell given its value.
      protected int numXCells
      Option used for specifying the number of possible states that will be rendered in a row (i.e., across the x-axis).
      protected int numYCells
      Option used for specifying the number of possible states that will be rendered in a column (i.e., across the y-axis).
      protected boolean renderValueString
      Whether the numeric string for the value of the state should be rendered in its cell or not.
      protected Color vsFontColor
      The font color of the value strings
      protected int vsFontSize
      The font point size of the value string
      protected float vsOffsetFromLeft
      A value between 0 and 1 indicating how far from the left of a value cell the value string should start being rendered.
      protected float vsOffsetFromTop
      A value between 0 and 1 indicating how from from the top of a value cell the value string should start be rendered.
      protected int vsPrecision
      The precision (number of decimals) shown in the value string.
      protected Object xKey
      variable key for the x variable
      protected VariableDomain xRange
      Range of the x key
      protected double xWidth
      Width of x cells
      protected Object yKey
      variable key for the y variable
      protected VariableDomain yRange
      Range of the y key
      protected double yWidth
      width of y cells

      • Fields inherited from class burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.StateValuePainter

        shouldRescaleValues

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StateValuePainter2D()
      Initializes using a LandmarkColorBlendInterpolation object that mixes from red (lowest value) to blue (highest value).
      StateValuePainter2D(ColorBlend colorBlend)
      Initializes the value painter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void paintStateValue(Graphics2D g2, State s, double value, float cWidth, float cHeight)
      Paints the representation of a value function for a specific state.
      void rescale(double lowerValue, double upperValue)
      Used to tell this painter that it should render state values so that the minimum possible value is lowerValue and the maximum is upperValue.
      void setColorBlend(ColorBlend colorBlend)
      Sets the color blending used for the value function.
      void setNumXCells(int numXCells)
      Sets the number of states that will be rendered along a row
      void setNumYCells(int numYCells)
      Sets the number of states that will be rendered along a row
      void setValueStringRenderingFormat(int fontSize, Color fontColor, int precision, float offsetFromLeft, float offsetFromTop)
      Sets the rendering format of the string displaying the value of each state.
      void setXYKeys(Object xKey, Object yKey, VariableDomain xRange, VariableDomain yRange, double xWidth, double yWidth)
      Sets the variable keys for the x and y variables in the state and the width of cells along those domains.
      void toggleValueStringRendering(boolean renderValueString)
      Enables or disables the rendering the text specifying the value of a state in its cell.

    • Field Detail

      • xKey

        protected Object xKey
        variable key for the x variable

      • yKey

        protected Object yKey
        variable key for the y variable

      • xRange

        protected VariableDomain xRange
        Range of the x key

      • yRange

        protected VariableDomain yRange
        Range of the y key

      • xWidth

        protected double xWidth
        Width of x cells

      • yWidth

        protected double yWidth
        width of y cells

      • colorBlend

        protected ColorBlend colorBlend
        The object to use for returning the color with which to fill the state cell given its value.

      • numXCells

        protected int numXCells
        Option used for specifying the number of possible states that will be rendered in a row (i.e., across the x-axis). -1 causes the attribute categorical size to be used instead.

      • numYCells

        protected int numYCells
        Option used for specifying the number of possible states that will be rendered in a column (i.e., across the y-axis). -1 causes the attribute categorical size to be used instead.

      • renderValueString

        protected boolean renderValueString
        Whether the numeric string for the value of the state should be rendered in its cell or not.

      • vsFontSize

        protected int vsFontSize
        The font point size of the value string

      • vsFontColor

        protected Color vsFontColor
        The font color of the value strings

      • vsOffsetFromLeft

        protected float vsOffsetFromLeft
        A value between 0 and 1 indicating how far from the left of a value cell the value string should start being rendered. 0 indicates stating at the left of the cell; 1 the right;

      • vsOffsetFromTop

        protected float vsOffsetFromTop
        A value between 0 and 1 indicating how from from the top of a value cell the value string should start be rendered. 0 indicates stating at the top of the cell; 1 the bottom;

      • vsPrecision

        protected int vsPrecision
        The precision (number of decimals) shown in the value string.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StateValuePainter2D

        public StateValuePainter2D()
        Initializes using a LandmarkColorBlendInterpolation object that mixes from red (lowest value) to blue (highest value).

      • StateValuePainter2D

        public StateValuePainter2D(ColorBlend colorBlend)
        Initializes the value painter.
        Parameters:
        colorBlend - the object to use for returning the color with which to fill the state cell given its value.

    • Method Detail

      • setColorBlend

        public void setColorBlend(ColorBlend colorBlend)
        Sets the color blending used for the value function.
        Parameters:
        colorBlend - the color blending used for the value function.

      • setXYKeys

        public void setXYKeys(Object xKey,
                      Object yKey,
                      VariableDomain xRange,
                      VariableDomain yRange,
                      double xWidth,
                      double yWidth)
        Sets the variable keys for the x and y variables in the state and the width of cells along those domains. The widths along the x dimension are how much of the variable space each rendered state will take.
        Parameters:
        xKey - the x variable key
        yKey - the y variable key
        xRange - the range of the x values
        yRange - the range of the y values
        xWidth - the width of a state along the x domain
        yWidth - the width of a state alone the y domain

      • toggleValueStringRendering

        public void toggleValueStringRendering(boolean renderValueString)
        Enables or disables the rendering the text specifying the value of a state in its cell.
        Parameters:
        renderValueString - if true, then text specifying the value of the state will be rendered; if false then it will not be rendered.

      • setValueStringRenderingFormat

        public void setValueStringRenderingFormat(int fontSize,
                                          Color fontColor,
                                          int precision,
                                          float offsetFromLeft,
                                          float offsetFromTop)
        Sets the rendering format of the string displaying the value of each state.
        Parameters:
        fontSize - the font size of the string
        fontColor - the color of the font
        precision - the precision of the value text printed (e.g., 2 means displaying 2 decimal places)
        offsetFromLeft - the offset from the left side of a state's cell that the text will begin being rendered. 0 means starting on the left boundary, 1 on the right boundary.
        offsetFromTop - the offset from the top side of a state's cell that the text will begin being rendered. 0 means starting on the top boundary, 1 on the bottom boundary.

      • setNumXCells

        public void setNumXCells(int numXCells)
        Sets the number of states that will be rendered along a row
        Parameters:
        numXCells - the number of states that will be rendered along a row

      • setNumYCells

        public void setNumYCells(int numYCells)
        Sets the number of states that will be rendered along a row
        Parameters:
        numYCells - the number of states that will be rendered along a column

      • rescale

        public void rescale(double lowerValue,
                    double upperValue)
        Description copied from class: StateValuePainter
        Used to tell this painter that it should render state values so that the minimum possible value is lowerValue and the maximum is upperValue.
        Specified by:
        rescale in class StateValuePainter
        Parameters:
        lowerValue - the minimum value of state values
        upperValue - the maximium value of state values

      • paintStateValue

        public void paintStateValue(Graphics2D g2,
                            State s,
                            double value,
                            float cWidth,
                            float cHeight)
        Description copied from class: StateValuePainter
        Paints the representation of a value function for a specific state.
        Specified by:
        paintStateValue in class StateValuePainter
        Parameters:
        g2 - graphics context to which the object should be painted
        s - the state of the object to be painted
        value - the value function evaluation of state s
        cWidth - width of the canvas size
        cHeight - height of the canvas size
